content.full_text:
Petition of William G. Jeter and Others to the Sangamon County Commissioners' Court,

1
paragraphs: Petition of William G. Jeter and Others to the Sangamon County Commissioners' Court,
citations:
Sangamon County Commissioners’ Court Record Book D, 5 December 1836, p. 268, 6 March
                     1837, p. 288, Manuscripts Department, Abraham Lincoln Presidential Library and Museum,
                     Springfield, IL.

footnotes.text:
1Abraham Lincoln wrote the text of this petition, but did not sign it.On December 5, 1836, Coleman Smoot presented this petition to the Sangamon County
                  Commissioners’ Court, who ordered James Pantier, William Sampson, and James Meadows
                  to view the road. The three commissioners reported back to the court on March 6, reporting
                  that they approved of the road. The court then ordered the road to be opened and kept
                  in repair by the county.Sangamon County Commissioners’ Court Record Book D, 5 December 1836, p. 268, 6 March
                     1837, p. 288, Manuscripts Department, Abraham Lincoln Presidential Library and Museum,
                     Springfield, IL.
2The route described here runs through present-day westernLoganand easternMenardcounties.
3There were two John Kings living in Sangamon  County during this time.

structured_content.text:
Petition of William G. Jeter and Others to the Sangamon County Commissioners' Court,
               [30 November 1836]1
